instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0A, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0V
threads.message:
MacBook had liquid damage on keyboard/trackpad.
Cant find any liquid on board.

Voltage and diode mode readings on both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> LDOs are correct.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> got 0V and 0.000V in diode mode.

F7000 removed and:
F7000/1 13.01V and 0.513V in diode mode
F7000/2 4Ohm resistance to ground, 0.002V in diode mode

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0A, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0V
threads.message:
Compare short value from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with all big coils.
Pay atention to CPU coils; 4 ohm can be good value there.
Any chip from CPU power supplies can transfer that value to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, if burnt.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0A, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0V
threads.message:
Coils with the same 0.004V diode mode reading:
L7430, L7410, L7420

Coils L7220, L7210 got 0.007V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0A, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0V
threads.message:
Lift one pin of L7410/20/30, one by one.
When the short disappears from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, remove the corresponding burnt <CHIP>U7410</CHIP>/20/30 chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0A, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0V
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> got now 13V.

Without battery it take 0.435A from a charger. 
Short fan spin, no chime, trackpad is clicking, caps lock led is not working,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0A, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0V
threads.message: What did you find burnt on the board?
